siteProductLine.name: Trail Hog
siteProductLine.overview:
An all-terrain tire, the Trail Hog from Kanati is designed for use on light trucks and SUVs and offers drivers consistent traction and improved responsiveness.

Features & Benefits
  • All-terrain tread
  • Black sidewall
  • Rugged shoulder blocks create additional biting edges to improve steering and control
  • Three Peak Mountain Snowflake symbols means this tire is certified to perform in severe snow conditions
siteProductLine.secondaryDescription: Some drivers long for a tire that's built to perform on any terrain, and all-terrain tires give these drivers the performance that they crave. Consider the Trail Hog from Kanati, which features a unique groove and siping pattern to improve all-season traction. A 3-ply sidewall reinforces the tire for added durability, and the Trail Hog's variable angled tread blocks reduce noise to give drivers a quiet, comfortable ride. Able to be pinned with #16 studs to increase traction in icy and snowy conditions, the Trail Hog includes rugged shoulder blocks that create extra biting edges to enhance steering and control.

siteProductSpecs.name: Category
siteProductSpecs.description: All-terrain tires offer drivers traction on- and off-road, and are typically used by light truck and SUV drivers who want a tire that's able to climb rocks and perform on the highway.

siteProductSpecs.name: Vehicle
siteProductSpecs.description: Designed for use on light trucks and SUVs such as the Ram 1500, Ford F-150, and Chevrolet Silverado. Light Truck tires are strong enough to support a truck's heavier weight and whatever else is being hauled or towed.

siteProductSpecs.name: Mileage Warranty
siteProductSpecs.description: This product is not covered by a manufacturer’s treadlife warranty.

siteProductSpecs.name: Load Index
siteProductSpecs.description:
The maximum carrying capacity for a tire determined by the manufacturer  
                (Single wheel applications / Dual wheel applications).

siteProductSpecs.name: Max Speed
siteProductSpecs.description: Maximum speed capability to safely carry a load for an extended period of time.

siteProductSpecs.name: Load Range
siteProductSpecs.description: The maximum load carrying strength at the specified inflation pressure, also known as ply rating.

siteProductSpecs.name: Sidewall
siteProductSpecs.description: The side of the tire between the tread and rim, with cosmetic branding as well as information about the tire including manufacturer, model, size, etc.

siteProductSpecs.name: Tread Depth
siteProductSpecs.description: Measured in 32nds of an inch, this metric shows how much tread life is left on a tire, with the tire's traction & stopping capabilities greatly diminished at 4/32nds and less. Tire manufacturers include "tire wear bars" at 2/32nds to indicate when your tire is worn out.

siteProductSpecs.name: Inflation Pressure
siteProductSpecs.description: The highest inflation pressure (measured in pounds of force per square inch, PSI) the tire is designed to contain, and should only be used when called for by the vehicle placard.

siteProductSpecs.name: Part Number
siteProductSpecs.description: An identifier of a particular tire line and size combination assigned by the tire manufacturer.

siteProductSpecs.name: Tread Design
siteProductSpecs.description: Tread design (or tread pattern) can affect handling, traction & noise for different driving styles & road conditions.

siteProductSpecs.name: Section Width
siteProductSpecs.description: The measurement of width from a tires inner sidewall to the outer sidewall.

siteProductSpecs.name: Rim Range
siteProductSpecs.description: The range of widths the rim of the vehicle can be for this tire to be safely mounted on.

siteProductSpecs.name: Overall Diameter
siteProductSpecs.description: The diameter of a tire that is inflated without any load applied.

siteProductSpecs.name: Three-Peak Mountain Snowflake (3PMS)
siteProductSpecs.description: A three-peak mountain snowflake (3PMSF) symbol branded on a tire's sidewall indicates the tire meets required performance criteria in snow testing to be considered severe snow service-rated.

siteProductSpecs.name: Studdable
siteProductSpecs.description: Molded specifically for optional use with studs. Studs not included. Stud sizes in TSMI (Tire Stud Manufacturer Index). Studs Restricted in certain states.

image.altText: All-Terrain Tires Driving on a Ricky Hillside

header.title: All Terrain tires
header.body:
# All Terrain tires
Commonly used on light trucks, jeeps, and SUVs, [All Terrain tires](https://simpletire.com/learn/tire-buying-guides/all-terrain-tires) are designed to give drivers strong traction and performance on- and off-road.

All Terrain tires often feature an aggressive tread pattern that allows them to conquer rocks, dirt, mud, and even snow, and reinforced sidewalls that are meant to withstand damage from off-road driving, and some All Terrain tires even features a Three Peak Mountain Snowflake certification thanks to their ability to perform in severe snow conditions. The most popular tire manufacturers make All Terrain tires including [BFGoodrich](https://simpletire.com/brands/bfgoodrich-tires/categories/all-terrain), [Cooper](https://simpletire.com/brands/cooper-tires/categories/all-terrain), [Toyo](https://simpletire.com/brands/toyo-tires/categories/all-terrain), [Pirelli](https://simpletire.com/brands/pirelli-tires/categories/all-terrain), [Firestone](https://simpletire.com/brands/firestone-tires/categories/all-terrain) and more.

If you're looking for a set all-terrain tires online then you've come to the right place, as SimpleTire has thousands of great all-terrain tires that meet your driving needs and budget.

[All terrain tire reviews](https://simpletire.com/categories/all-terrain-tires/reviews)

articleList.description: Learn about what all terrain tires are, what they are capable of and what type of car and driver needs them based on advice from our SimpleTire tire experts.
